175.article_body: AAP leader Atishi on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi and BJP’s "modus operandi" to topple governments is to use central agencies. "They first use these agencies...CBI, ED...to lodge cases against leaders (of Opposition parties)…BJP reaches those leaders and offers them to join…party with the promise to close all cases against them," Atishi added.

176.title: Andhra CM Jagan Mohan Reddy meets PM Narendra Modi in Delhi
176.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Mohan Reddy met PM Narendra Modi at his residence today in the national capital. This is his second meeting with the PM in the last three months. He is also expected to meet some of the Union Ministers. He met the PM earlier this year and discussed about many projects including Polavaram, Kadapa Steel Plant, etc.

177.title: Dehradun Police team leaves for Gurugram to arrest Bobby Kataria
177.article_body: A Dehradun Police team has left for Gurugram to arrest social media influencer Bobby Kataria for allegedly having liquor on a road by blocking traffic last month. The police will move court for confiscation of Kataria's property if he is not found, an official said. He added that two notices had already been issued to Kataria earlier this month.

178.title: Ease of doing drug business: Rahul to PM Modi on Guj drug hauls
178.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi on Monday over multiple drug busts from Gujarat and asked for how long he would be silent on the matter. "Drugs worth thousands of crores are reaching Gujarat. Who is spreading this poison in the holy land of Gandhi-Patel," Gandhi said in a tweet in Hindi.

179.title: Mobile phone charger explodes, catches fire in MP; 4-year-old boy injured
179.article_body: A mobile phone charger exploded in the hands of a 4-year-old boy and got stuck in his hand after he grabbed the phone which was charging in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur. The charger got stuck in the boy's fingers and caught fire after the explosion. The child is undergoing treatment and has suffered severe burn injuries on his hand.

180.title: Gunmen kidnapped 4 Catholic nuns on a highway in Nigeria: Convent
180.article_body: A local convent said on Monday that gunmen have kidnapped four Catholic nuns on a highway in Nigeria's Imo. The convent's secretary general said that the abducted nuns had been travelling from Rivers to Imo for a thanksgiving mass. Earlier in June, a lawmaker had said that at least 50 people were killed after gunmen attacked a church in Ondo.

181.title: All the rumours about Kartik Aaryan hiking his fee are baseless: Director
181.article_body: A Bollywood director, who is working with Kartik Aaryan on an upcoming project, has refuted the reports claiming that the 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' actor has hiked up his fee. "Kartik is a very grounded guy in reality...All the rumours about him hiking his fee are baseless," the director on the condition of anonymity said. Kartik will next feature in 'Shehzada'.

182.title: Pune NCP protests over reservation in govt jobs for Govindas
182.article_body: The Pune NCP on Monday staged a protest against Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's announcement over reservation in government jobs for Dahi Handi participants. The protesters said this will be an injustice to those preparing for government jobs. Last week, the CM announced that Govindas playing Dahi Handi will be eligible for government jobs under the 5% sports quota.

183.title: Hyderabad Police to increase number of patrolling vehicles
183.article_body: The Hyderabad Police will be increasing the number of patrolling vehicles at Banjara Hills and Jubilee Hills police stations to reduce the emergency response time due to high number of dial 100 calls received from these areas. The police stations having larger jurisdictions have also been allotted extra quota of fuel for patrol vehicles, Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand said.

184.title: K Kavitha to file defamation case after BJP leaders call her AAP-liquor mafia middleman
184.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and MLC K Kavitha said that she will file defamation case against Delhi BJP leaders Parvesh Verma and Manjinder Singh Sirsa after they said that she acted as a "middleman" between liquor mafia and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government. "I don't have any link...with what was said in...Delhi Excise scam," K Kavitha said.

185.title: Wrong judgement of driver: BJP's Fadnavis on ex-MLC's accident
185.article_body: Days after former MLC Vinayak Mete died in a car crash on Mumbai-Pune Expressway, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that it was an "utterly wrong judgement" of Mete's driver. The 52-year-old Shiv Sangram party leader was killed after his car hit a truck on August 14. Police had said that Mete's driver was trying to overtake a truck.

186.title: BJP offered me CM post if I break AAP: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia
186.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday alleged that BJP offered him the Chief Minister's post if he broke AAP. He claimed that someone came to him with two offers from BJP. Sisodia added that he was told that all big cases registered against him by CBI and ED would be taken back if he quit AAP and joined BJP.

187.title: Radhakishan Damani likely to be main trustee of Jhunjhunwala's estate: Report
187.article_body: DMart's billionaire owner Radhakishan Damani is likely to be the main trustee of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's estate, Moneycontrol reported. Damani is said to have the final say in the main publicly listed investments of Jhunjhunwala. The investor, who passed away last week, reportedly left his assets, including investments in listed and unlisted firms, mainly to his wife and children.

188.title: Sensex plunges over 870 points to close at 58,773, Nifty ends below 17,500
188.article_body: Sensex on Monday plunged by 872 points to close at 58,773, whereas the Nifty was down 267 points to settle below 17,500, marking the second consecutive decline for the benchmark indices. Shares of ITC, Coal India, Tata Consumer Products, Nestle India and Britannia Industries were among top Nifty gainers. Meanwhile, Tata Steel, Asian Paints, Adani Ports were among major losers.

189.title: Chiranjeevi is ageless megastar, has same pace & grace: 'Bholaa...' director
189.article_body: Filmmaker Meher Ramesh has said that directing actor Chiranjeevi in 'Bholaa Shankar' was a dream come true for him. "Chiranjeevi is an ageless megastar...No other actor or star has this kind of stardom even after all these years," he added. "Even now he is acting as a lead actor...he is doing it with the same grace and speed," he stated.

190.title: Rhea shares pics of herself crying on seeing Sonam Kapoor’s newborn
190.article_body: Rhea Kapoor on Monday introduced Instagram to her 'nephew' and Sonam Kapoor-Anand Ahuja's son, who was born on August 20. Rhea shared photos of herself in which she can be seen crying at the sight of her newborn nephew. Calling Sonam "the bravest mommy" and Anand "the most loving dad", Rhea described the moment as "unreal".

191.title: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' goes on floors, Akshay is first guest: Reports
191.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma has reportedly started shooting for the new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', which he announced on Sunday. As per reports, Kapil is shooting the first episode with Akshay Kumar, who will be promoting his upcoming film 'Cuttputlli' on the show. Along with Akshay, the episode will reportedly feature Rakul Preet Singh and Sargun Mehta.

192.title: KCR’s family attended meetings on formulation of Delhi excise policy: BJP MP
192.article_body: BJP MP Parvesh Verma has claimed that Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao's family members attended meetings on the formulation of the Delhi excise policy at a hotel. "KCR's family members got the same policy implemented in Punjab. They prepared a plan for Delhi along with Manish Sisodia and Arvind Kejriwal," Verma added.

193.title: 55-yr-old kills 11-yr-old girl for reporting his misbehaviour in B'luru
193.article_body: A 55-year-old man killed his 11-year-old neighbour, allegedly after she reported his misbehaviour, before stabbing himself to death in Bengaluru on Sunday, police said. The accused had blocked the girl when she was going down the stairs, following which he had been asked to move out, officers said. He stabbed her after failing to find a place for rent.

194.title: KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant could be India's all-format captains in future: Karim
194.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has named KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant as the players who can become India's all-format captain in the future. "For how long Rohit can continue given his injury woes? So, these things also have to be kept in mind," added Karim. Rahul captained India in a Test and three ODIs against South Africa earlier this year.

195.title: 22-year-old Shubman Gill smashes his first-ever hundred in international cricket
195.article_body: Team India opener Shubman Gill on Monday smashed his first-ever hundred in international cricket. The 22-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 82 deliveries against Zimbabwe in the third ODI. Shubman, who made his international debut in an ODI in 2019, took 30 international innings to record his maiden international ton.

196.title: Shubman breaks Rohit's record, becomes youngest Indian to smash a hundred in Zimbabwe
196.article_body: Opener Shubman Gill has become the youngest-ever Indian to smash a hundred in international cricket on Zimbabwean soil. Gill slammed a hundred in the third ODI against Zimbabwe in Harare aged 22 years and 348 days. He broke the record set by Rohit Sharma, who had slammed an ODI ton in Zimbabwe aged 23 years and 28 days.

197.title: I've made sure I'm the one paying for kids' education: Twinkle Khanna
197.article_body: Actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna has said that she has always made sure that she is the one paying for her children's education. "I want them to say that my mother paid for my education and not just fed me aloo parathas," she added. Twinkle further revealed she never had a joint account with her husband and actor Akshay Kumar.

198.title: Garcia becomes first-ever qualifier to win WTA 1000 title at Cincinnati Open
198.article_body: Unseeded Caroline Garcia beat two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova 6-2, 6-4 to win Cincinnati Open title on Sunday and became the first-ever qualifier to win a WTA 1000 title. "Don't know how to describe that week because I came here on Wednesday night to get ready for qualifiers," said Garcia. Garcia beat three top-10 opponents en route to the final.

199.title: B'day wishes to my brother whom I love, respect: Pawan to Chiranjeevi
199.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Pawan Kalyan wished actor Chiranjeevi on his 67th birthday. "My wholehearted birthday wishes to my beloved brother whom I love, respect and adore," he tweeted. "Wishing you good health, success and glory on this special day," he added. Chiranjeevi will next feature in 'GodFather'.

200.title: Paine returns to Tasmania team after break over sexting scandal
200.article_body: Ex-Australian Test captain Tim Paine is reportedly set to make his competitive cricket comeback in the upcoming Sheffield Shield season. Cricket Tasmania CEO Dom Baker has confirmed that Paine has been training with the state squad. Paine had resigned from captaincy and had taken an indefinite break from all cricket amid his 'd**k pic' scandal last year.

201.title: Man kills 33-year-old wife in front of children over dowry in Hyd
201.article_body: A man killed his 33-year-old wife in front of their children in Hyderabad's Uppal district over a dowry dispute. The deceased had lodged a complaint a few years back and the police helped the couple reconcile. The accused, after having fought with his wife over the same issue, killed her in front of their children and escaped.

202.title: 68,000 candidates register for Agniveer rally at Army's Pune office
202.article_body: As many as 68,000 candidates have registered at the Pune office of the Indian Army for the second Agniveer recruitment rally. The rally is being organised at Mahatma Phule Krishi Vidyapeeth at Rahuri in Ahmednagar from August 23 (Tuesday) to September 11. A daily footfall of around 5,000 candidates is expected, Army officials said.

203.title: US is procrastinating talks to revive 2015 nuclear deal: Iran
203.article_body: Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesperson Nasser Kanaani on Monday accused the US of "procrastinating" indirect talks to revive the 2015 nuclear deal and said that there is "inaction" from the European sides. Adding that the agreement is needed more by the US and Europe than Iran, he also stated that Tehran wanted a "sustainable deal that would preserve its legitimate rights".

204.title: Comedian Kapil Sharma makes ramp-walk debut at Beti Fashion Show
204.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma marked his debut on the ramp as he turned showstopper for Anu Ranjan's Beti Fashion Show over the weekend. Kapil was dressed in a black puff-sleeve jacket, which was paired with black pants featuring gold patchwork. A video shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani shows Kapil walking the ramp and also imitating female models at the end.

205.title: 2019 bronze medallist Praneeth crashes out of World Championships 2022
205.article_body: Sai Praneeth crashed out of World Championships 2022 in Tokyo after losing in first round on Monday. The 2019 bronze medallist lost to fourth-seeded Chou Tien Chen 15-21, 21-15, 15-21. In women's doubles, Indian duo of Ashwini Ponnappa and Sikki Reddy entered second round with a 21-7, 21-9 win over Maldives' Aminath Nabeeha Abdul Razzaq and Fathimath Nabaaha Abdul Razzaq.

206.title: Akasa Air operates 2 flights daily between Bengaluru & Mumbai
206.article_body: Newly-launched Akasa Air has started operating flights between Bengaluru and Mumbai twice daily. The budget carrier currently operates from Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Kochi and Mumbai. The first Akasa Air flight operated between Mumbai and Ahmedabad on August 7 this year and it also began operations from Bengaluru to Kochi on August 12.

207.title: SC stays Delhi HC order to file FIR against Shahnawaz Hussain in rape case
207.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday stayed a Delhi High Court order to register a First Information Report (FIR) against BJP leader Syed Shahnawaz Hussain in a 2018 rape complaint. "We are prima facie of the view that the matter requires consideration. We will issue notice and stay all proceedings," a Bench led by Justice UU Lalit said.

208.title: Farmers stopped at Ghazipur border, allowed to proceed after due verification: Police
208.article_body: Some farmers who had gathered for protests in the national capital on Monday were stopped at the Ghazipur border, "in view of the heightened security measures and threat perception", police said. "However, after due verifications, all of them were allowed to proceed to their respective destinations," DCP (East district) Priyanka Kashyap added.

209.title: Euro falls to parity with US dollar for the second time this year
209.article_body: The euro briefly slipped below parity with the US dollar on Monday amid fear regarding recession in the euro zone. The currency was trading at exactly $1 after recovering marginally. This is the second time the euro has hit parity with dollar this year. In July, the euro reached parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years.

210.title: Philippine kids return to schools after 2 yrs as COVID-19 curbs ease
210.article_body: Millions of children returned to classrooms for their first in-person class as all schools were reopened in the Philippines on Monday after two years, as the country eased coronavirus restrictions. In November last year, the country had opened some schools in a pilot project to test in-person classes. Precautions like mandating face masks and temperature checks are in place.

211.title: Vodafone agrees to sell Hungarian unit for $1.8 billion
211.article_body: Britain's Vodafone has agreed to sell its Hungarian business for $1.8 billion in cash as part of its plan to simplify its business. The firm has sold its assets to 4iG Public and state-run Corvinus Zrt. The deal does not include Vodafone's shared services business VOIS and is expected to create Hungary's second largest telecoms operator.

212.title: Mike Tyson punched me by mistake, I had migraine for whole day: Vijay Deverakonda
212.article_body: Talking about boxing legend Mike Tyson who has made a cameo in his upcoming film 'Liger', actor Vijay Deverakonda said Tyson punched him by mistake during rehearsals. "I had migraine for the whole day...I didn’t get knocked out...but body wanted to fall down," he added. "I was worried when I saw his hands, his foot and his neck," he remarked.

213.title: Man shooting video with snake dies after reptile bites him in Uttar Pradesh
213.article_body: A man shooting a video with a snake in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur died after he was allegedly bitten by the reptile. The deceased was reportedly famous in the area for rescuing snakes and had caught more than 200 snakes in the village. The snake with which he was allegedly shooting the video, was caught from his neighbour's house, reports said.

214.title: Mumbai woman mistakenly consumes poison instead of stomach medicine, dies
214.article_body: A 24-year-old woman in Mumbai mistakenly consumed rat poison instead of medicine for stomach ache. She died a week later, police said. The incident took place on August 13 at around 9.30 pm. The deceased had called her mother to tell her that she was vomiting after consuming poison and that she needed help. She was taken to the hospital.

215.title: 'Hera Pheri' producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala passes away aged 91
215.article_body: Veteran producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala, who produced films like 'Hera Pheri' and 'Lahoo Ke Do Rang', passed away aged 91. He reportedly died due to cardiac arrest while being treated at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai. Mourning his demise, actor Ajay Devgn tweeted, "Deepest condolences...My father and he were associates during the golden era of our cinema."

216.title: I guess I was too relaxed to lose, it cost me: Tsitsipas on Cincinnati Open final
216.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas has said he was "too relaxed" against Borna Coric in the final of the Cincinnati Open. "Coric was obviously the opposite of what I was...Sometimes it makes you not be that much present in the moment when you're too relaxed. It takes away that momentum that you are trying to capture," added Tsitsipas.

217.title: Sanjay Raut’s custody extended till September 5 in land scam case
217.article_body: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court extended the judicial custody of Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut till September 5 in the Patra Chawl land scam case. The Enforcement Directorate stated that releasing Raut at this time will hamper the investigation since he has great influence and it is possible that he will tamper with the evidence.

218.title: Ford ordered to pay $1.7 billion over pickup truck crash that killed US couple
218.article_body: A jury has ordered Ford Motor to pay $1.7 billion after a US couple was killed in a pickup truck crash in 2014. The couple died after a tyre blew out on a local highway and their 2002 Ford Super Duty F-250 pickup rolled over. Following the crash, the couple's children sued Ford alleging the pickup had a weak roof.

219.title: We're working on the script: Jennifer Grey on 'Dirty Dancing' sequel
219.article_body: Actress Jennifer Grey, speaking about the 'Dirty Dancing' sequel said, "I can't tell you much...but I'll tell you that it will involve Baby (her character in the film)." She further added that they are working on the script for the sequel. She added, "We're going to shoot it in the spring of 2023...it comes out on February 9, 2024."

220.title: 5-km-long jam at Delhi-Noida border due to police checking; pics surface
220.article_body: A five-kilometre-long traffic jam was seen at Noida-Delhi Link Road at Chilla Border amid checking of vehicles by police personnel in wake of farmers' protests in the national capital today. Huge traffic snarls were also reported on Delhi-Meerut Expressway, NH-9 and DND flyway. Delhi Traffic Police said that they have deployed additional traffic personnel to handle the situation.

221.title: Slaves of Gujarat: KTR shares video of BJP leader fetching Amit Shah's sandals
221.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao shared a video in which Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar is seen fetching sandals of Union Home Minister Amit Shah when the latter visited a temple in the state. Reacting to it, Rao said that the people of Telangana are watching the "slaves of Gujarat" and will reverse any attempt to denigrate Telangana's "self-respect".

222.title: Priyanka Gandhi should campaign across India: Hanumantha Rao
222.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao said that party's General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra should campaign across the country and not only stick to Uttar Pradesh. "If Rahul Gandhi is not available, she should also visit south India to strengthen the party at the ground level," said Rao. He further added that Priyanka should contest from Medak constituency like her grandmother.

223.title: GHMC likely to convert Sardar Mahal into a museum: Reports
223.article_body: According to reports, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will convert Sardar Mahal into a museum which will display the history of the area. The GHMC is scheduled to meet on August 29 where it is likely to give a nod to the proposal. It is located near Charminar and is one of the historical monuments in Hyderabad.

224.title: 16 trauma care centres set up in Hyderabad
224.article_body: Telangana government has set up 16 trauma care centres and 10 advance life support ambulances on the Outer Ring Road of Hyderabad. Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao appealed to people to spread the word about the life-saving trauma care facility. The government also issued new toll-free numbers (1066/1059102) which can be used during any emergency.

225.title: Man rapes & murders 8-yr-old in Delhi, dumps her body in Yamuna
225.article_body: A 36-year-old butcher has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly kidnapping an 8-year-old girl while she was sleeping at her house, raping her, slitting her throat and dumping her body in the Yamuna. The post-mortem revealed that the accused also disfigured the victim's face using a sharp weapon to destroy her identity. The victim's parents work as labourers.

226.title: Tesla's Autopilot averts 40 crashes/day caused by sudden acceleration: Exec
226.article_body: Tesla's Autopilot Software Director Ashok Elluswamy has said that the firm's Autopilot prevents around 40 crashes per day that would have been caused by sudden unintended acceleration (SUA). He shared instances where drivers misapplied the pedals and were saved by Autopilot. He even shared a video in which he claims the Autopilot saved a man's legs from getting injured.

227.title: 4 members of family killed after car falls into gorge in Himachal
227.article_body: Four members of a family were killed after their car skidded off the road and fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba on Sunday. The victims were identified as Chamba head post office's postal superintendent Tilak Raj, his wife and teenage children. Villagers said they heard a bang and rushed to the spot but the victims had already passed.

228.title: Islamic State suicide bomber plotting to attack Indian leader detained in Russia
228.article_body: The Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) has said that its officers have detained a suicide bomber, a member of the Islamic State terrorist group, who was plotting an attack in India. Russia said that he "planned to commit a terrorist act by blowing himself up against one of the representatives of the ruling circles of India".

229.title: Thankless task: Russian minister on speculating strategic talks with US
229.article_body: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergey Ryabkov has said that the possibility of the resumption of strategic talks with US "is far from obvious" given the "recklessly aggressive" policy that Washington is pursuing towards Moscow. Moreover, he added that speculating about prospects for strategic dialogue with US, "especially in the conditions when the Americans broke it off, is a thankless task."

230.title: Sajad Lone warns of hunger strike over voting rights to outsiders in J&K
230.article_body: J&K People’s Conference President Sajad Lone commented on the matter of inclusion of outsiders in J&K electoral rolls. "If we feel there is demographic intervention or the rights of the people of J&K are compromised, then we will sit on hunger strike in front of Parliament in Delhi," Lone said. "We're scared of those implementing the law," he added.

231.title: Farooq Abdullah holds all-party meet over 'inclusion of non-local voters' in J&K
231.article_body: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah on Monday held an all-party meeting regarding the "inclusion of non-locals as voters" in J&K at his residence in Srinagar. Meanwhile, J&K People's Conference President Sajad Lone opted out of the meeting. "If this effort (all party meeting) was serious, it would not be held under media gaze," Lone said.

232.title: Attack on Salman Rushdie designed to create regime of fear: IMSD
232.article_body: The Indian Muslims for Secular Democracy (IMSD) condemned the attack on 'The Satanic Verses' writer Salman Rushdie and questioned the silence of Muslim organisations. IMSD said in a statement that the attack was designed to create a regime of fear. It added that the silence of Muslims emboldens "Islamophobes to paint the religion as a creed of violence and terror".

233.title: Video shows mob climbing building to catch Hindu man over fake blasphemy case in Pak
233.article_body: A Hindu man in Pakistan was booked in a fake blasphemy case over alleged desecration of Quran, reports said. A video shows hundreds of people around an apartment building and some climbing the building to get hold of Ashok Kumar. The video shows police dispersing the mob by lathicharging. Reports added that a Muslim woman had actually burned the Quran.

234.title: No place for Manish Sisodia in BJP: Parvesh Verma
234.article_body: Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Verma reacted to Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's claim that the BJP had offered to "shut all cases" against him if he quit AAP and crossed over. "Sisodia is not welcomed in BJP and he has no place here," Verma said. Not only BJP but no other party should allow Sisodia to join them, he added.

235.title: FTX's revenue jumped by more than 1,000% in a year, leaked documents show
235.article_body: The revenue of privately held crypto exchange FTX surged more than 1,000% from $89 million in 2020 to $1.02 billion in 2021, according to leaked internal documents. Further, its operating income was $272 million in 2021, up from $14 million a year earlier. FTX saw net income of $388 million last year, up from just $17 million a year earlier.

236.title: Musk lists main goals for Tesla & SpaceX for 2022, says 'will require insane work'
236.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk took to Twitter on Monday to share his two main goals for this year. He said that sending SpaceX's Starship rocket to the Earth's orbit and a wide release of Tesla's full-self driving software are the "two giant kahunas". Musk further noted that the goals will require "insane work by many super talented people".

237.title: It's in his own hands: Shahid Afridi on Kohli's future ahead of Asia Cup
237.article_body: During a question-answer session on Twitter, ex-Pakistan skipper Shahid Afridi was asked about Virat Kohli's future. "It's in his own hands," replied Afridi. The former all-rounder was also asked about his views on Kohli's century drought in international cricket since 2019. "Only tough times can unearth big players," said Afridi. Kohli will return to competitive cricket at the Asia Cup.

238.title: 3 policemen kneel on man & repeatedly kick, punch his face in US; suspended
238.article_body: Three police officers have been suspended in US' Arkansas after a video showing them beating up an alleged suspect went viral. The video shows the officers kneeling on him before punching his face and kicking him repeatedly. One of the officers was also seen slamming his head onto the ground. According to police, the man had assaulted an officer first.

239.title: Massive setback for Pakistan: Inzamam on Shaheen getting ruled out of Asia Cup
239.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has said that pacer Shaheen Afridi's absence from Asia Cup is a "massive setback" for the Babar Azam-led side. "If you look at the last match against India, Shaheen created pressure right from the very first over," added Inzamam. Shaheen had dismissed KL Rahul, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in their T20 World Cup match last year.

240.title: Teen who was pursuing rape case found dead in canal in UP
240.article_body: The body of a 17-year-old girl was recovered in a canal in UP's Barabanki district on Saturday after she went missing on August 18. The victim told her parents that she is going to meet her lawyer to discuss a rape case she lodged in January. Police suspect she died by suicide and her body has been sent for postmortem.

241.title: SC terminates CoA set up to manage All India Football Federation
241.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has dissolved the Committee of Administrators (CoA) that was set up to manage All India Football Federation (AIFF). The SC said it is passing the order to facilitate revocation of suspension of AIFF by FIFA and holding of Under-17 FIFA World Cup in India as well as allowing participation of teams from India in international events.

242.title: Allu Arjun & Rashmika Mandanna-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rule' goes on floors
242.article_body: The shooting of Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rule' began on Monday. Taking to Instagram, the makers of the film said that they will hold a pooja ceremony on Monday and added, "Pushpa Raj is back! This time to Rule." The film also features Rashmika Mandanna and Fahadh Faasil. The sequel to the 2021 film will be directed by Sukumar.

243.title: Bumped into each other in lift, was lovely meeting him: Papon on Mohanlal
243.article_body: Singer Papon has said that it was "lovely meeting" actor Mohanlal and called him "a great and humble artist". He added, "We bumped [into] each other in the lift...he came to my room and I hosted him with a warm welcome in my state." Speaking about meeting Mohanlal, Papon further said that it felt like meeting an elder brother.

244.title: Railways to ply 6 Ganpati special trains between Mumbai and Mangaluru
244.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) announced that it will run six additional Ganpati special trains between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus and Mangaluru Junction to manage the rush of passengers during the festive season. Earlier, the Central Railway announced running of 212 Ganpati specials. With the introduction of six additional trains, the total number of Ganpati specials this year will be 218.

245.title: MSP is not being implemented because PM has a friend whose name is Adani: Satya Pal Malik
245.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik on Sunday said, "The MSP is not being implemented because Prime Minister has a friend whose name is Adani, who at the moment has become Asia's richest person in five years." He added, "You cannot defeat the farmer. You cannot scare him...since you cannot send ED or Income-Tax officers, how will you scare the farmer?"

246.title: Pak army truck plunges into ravine in PoK; 9 killed, 4 injured
246.article_body: At least nine Pakistani soldiers were killed and four others injured after an army truck they were travelling in plunged into a ravine in Shaujabad area in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) on Sunday. According to the Pakistan army's media wing Inter-Services Public Relations, the incident occurred during routine military duty, Geo TV reported. The injured soldiers were taken to a hospital.

247.title: IMD issues red alert for heavy rainfall in 39 districts of Madhya Pradesh
247.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued red alert for heavy rainfall in 39 districts of Madhya Pradesh. Red alert has been issued in districts including Bhopal, Ujjain, Jabalpur, Ratlam, Neemuch and Mandsaur. Moderate rainfall has also been predicted in 12 districts including Indore, Gwalior, Dhar and Khargone. Schools in Narmadapuram and Bhopal have been shut in view of heavy rains.

248.title: Switzerland's Credit Suisse appoints Dixit Joshi as Chief Financial Officer
248.article_body: Switzerland's second-biggest bank Credit Suisse on Monday announced the appointment of Dixit Joshi as its new Chief Financial Officer. Joshi will take over on October 1, replacing David Mathers who previously announced he is stepping down. Joshi joins Credit Suisse from Deutsche Bank after nearly 12 years. He served as the German bank's Group Treasurer in his last role.

249.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd ODI against Zimbabwe
249.article_body: Team India captain KL Rahul won the toss for the third time in the row and elected to bat first against Zimbabwe in the third ODI in Harare. India have made two changes to their playing XI with Deepak Chahar and Avesh Khan replacing Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna. Zimbabwe have also made two changes to their playing XI.

250.title: Disha Patani is still among few I'd call if I need help: Krishna Shroff
250.article_body: Tiger Shroff's sister Krishna Shroff has said that actress Disha Patani is "one of the first few people" she would call if she needed help. "I know she'd be there. In a world, where women are constantly pulling each other down, she and I are the opposite," she added. This comes after Disha and Tiger reportedly ended their relationship.

251.title: Stardom is just a by-product: Pranay on Kareena's OTT actors remark
251.article_body: Speaking about actress Kareena Kapoor's OTT actors remark, actor Pranay Singh Pachauri stated that stardom is just the by-product of acting. Kareena had said that OTT actors have shown stars their standing. "Whatever Kareena ma'am has seen, none of us have even touched it. It takes a lot of courage and being down to earth to...say that," the actor added.

252.title: Big Tech's India executives to depose before Parliamentary panel
252.article_body: The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Finance has asked Indian executives of tech giants like Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, Google and Netflix to testify on Tuesday. The meeting will address the 'anti-competitive practices by big tech companies', a notice by the Lok Sabha Secretariat said. Tech giants are facing a probe by the Competition Commission of India over alleged anti-competitive practices.

253.title: Landslide hits Shi'ite Muslim shrine in Iraq; 4 dead, 6 rescued
253.article_body: At least four people were killed and six survivors were pulled out from the rubble after a landslide hit a Shi'ite Muslim shrine in Iraq's Karbala, the health ministry said on Sunday. The search and rescue operation is ongoing, the ministry added. Preliminary information suggests that the incident occurred due to humidity, a statement by the civil defence service said.

254.title: People angry over CBI action against Sisodia, joining AAP: Kejriwal
254.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said a large number of people are joining AAP as there is "a lot of anger" among them over CBI action against Manish Sisodia. "Every morning, they wake up and start the CBI, ED game…How will country progress like this?" asked Kejriwal. His remark came after CBI conducted a raid at Sisodia's residence.

255.title: 8-month pregnant woman critical after being assaulted in Kolkata
255.article_body: An eight-month pregnant woman was hospitalised in Kolkata after a group of men allegedly kicked her abdomen, thrashed her family members, and ransacked their home over a real estate dispute. Police arrested seven attackers involved who were said to be supporters of TMC Beleghata MLA Paresh Paul. However, the MLA rubbished the charges that the attackers were his workers.

256.title: Google Maps users spot 'downed' plane in Australian forest; govt calls it 'ghost image'
256.article_body: A picture from Google Maps shared by its users appears to show a downed passenger plane in a rainforest in Australia. The Australian Transport Safety Bureau said that it was unaware of any missing passenger jets. "There appears to be a phenomenon called ghost images and that could be what this is," Australia's Civil Aviation Safety Authority said.

257.title: Google shut my account, flagged me for abuse over nude pics of my sick kid: US man
257.article_body: A San Francisco man has alleged that Google shut down his account after he used his Android smartphone to take photos of an infection on his child's groin. Google flagged those pictures as child sexual abuse material (CSAM), the man claimed, adding that the police had opened an investigation into him. The investigator ultimately decided that no crime had occurred.

258.title: Allu Arjun attends India Day parade in New York, shares pic with Mayor doing 'Pushpa' step
258.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun attended India Day parade in New York on Sunday, pictures and videos of which have surfaced online. He also shared a selfie with New York Mayor Eric Adams, showing both of them doing hand brush signature move from the film 'Pushpa'. "It was a pleasure meeting the Mayor of New York City. Very Sportive Gentleman," Arjun wrote.

259.title: I've to introduce myself but people chant Vijay's name everywhere: Ananya
259.article_body: Speaking about promoting her upcoming film 'Liger', actress Ananya Panday stated that she has to introduce herself wherever she goes because she is just starting out. "[My co-star] Vijay (Deverakonda) was also doing the same but he slowly realised that people already know him too well. They were chanting his name everywhere!" the actress added.

260.title: KCR bowed down before CPI to win by-polls: Revanth Reddy
260.article_body: Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee President Revanth Reddy alleged that Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao bowed down before the feet of the Communist Party of India (CPI) to win the upcoming by-elections in the Munugode Assembly constituency. He expressed his disappointment at the CPI leaders' choice to back the TRS party in the by-elections.

261.title: Every university has lunatic fringe, they can't define its identity: JNU VC
261.article_body: The Left has been dominant in JNU and they have done very good work but the problem comes when they say other narratives cannot exist, JNU VC Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit said. "Every university has a lunatic fringe. There are troublemakers, they can be left, right, centre, anything but they cannot define the identity of the university," Pandit added.

262.title: Limit number of devotees, remove VIP enclosure: Mathura temple priests
262.article_body: The number of devotees inside Mathura's Bankey Bihari temple at a time should be restricted while the VIP enclosure should be removed, priests at the shrine said. The suggestions came a day after two persons died due to suffocation and six others were injured during Janmashtami celebrations. A new bigger temple should be constructed, ex-president of shrine's management committee said.

263.title: Bumrah won't be missed that much in the death overs at Asia Cup: Sanjay Bangar
263.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said pacer Jasprit Bumrah won't be missed "that much" in the death overs in the Aisa Cup. "Arshdeep...has a lot of control and an excellent temperament to bowl in the death overs," he stated. "One over where the team uses Bumrah in the middle overs, there his absence will definitely be felt," added Bangar.

264.title: Germany's Scholz heads to Canada with focus on energy talks
264.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz departed for a three-day visit to Canada to hold talks on energy security, Russian invasion of Ukraine and China. The two sides are expected to sign a long-term deal on close cooperation on renewable energies like green hydrogen. Scholz, joined by German Economy Minister and Vice Chancellor, will hold talks with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

265.title: BJP said break AAP and join BJP, will close all CBI, ED cases: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia
265.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday tweeted, "BJP's message has come to me - break AAP and join BJP, will get all CBI, ED cases closed." He added, "My reply to BJP - I am a Rajput, a descendant of Maharana Pratap. I will cut off my head but will not bow down in front of the corrupt-conspirators."

266.title: Train coach turned into restaurant with capacity of 70-75 in Raj's Barmer
266.article_body: A railway-themed restaurant inside a coach of a train will be opening soon at the Barmer railway station in Rajasthan, an official statement by North Western Railway said. Around 70 to 75 people will be able to sit inside the restaurant at a time. The surrounding area of the coach has also been developed for customers wishing to sit outside.

267.title: Dharamshala breaks heavy rainfall record in 64 yrs, 333 mm rain recorded in 12 hrs
267.article_body: Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala has broken the record of heavy rains in 64 years, Himachal Pradesh State Disaster Response Force said. "During the 12 hours from 9:00 pm on Friday to 9:00 am on Saturday, 333 mm of rain was recorded in Dharamshala. Earlier on 6 August, 1958, 316 mm of rain had fallen during 24 hours," the tweet read.

268.title: Coric beats Tsitsipas to become lowest-ranked player to claim a Masters Trophy
268.article_body: Croatia's Borna Coric created history by becoming the lowest-ranked player to claim a Masters Trophy after defeating Stefanos Tsitsipas to win the men's singles title at the Cincinnati Open. The world number 152 won the final with a scoreline of 7-6(7-0), 6-2. Coric returned to the ATP Tour in March after eight months on the sidelines with a shoulder injury.

269.title: Contradictory positions: Omar on Cong demanding Sisodia's resignation
269.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah criticised Congress' call for Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's resignation in connection with excise policy case. "I'm not disputing opportunistic politics of AAP...My limited point was about Congress' contradictory positions where investigative agencies are concerned," Omar tweeted. "How can agencies be...credible and discredited at same time?" he asked.

270.title: Zelenskyy warns Russia against putting Ukrainian soldiers on trial
270.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has warned Russia against putting its soldiers on trial, saying, "There are enough reports in...media that in Mariupol the scenery is being prepared for an absolutely disgusting and absurd show trial of Ukrainian defenders." He added that if this "despicable show trial takes place", this would be the line beyond which "any negotiations are impossible".

271.title: Delhi Air Traffic Controller tests positive for psychoactive substance, removed: Reports
271.article_body: An Air Traffic Controller at the Delhi airport has tested positive for a psychoactive substance and has been removed from duty by the aviation regulator DGCA, reports said. This is reportedly the first instance in the country of an ATC testing positive for a psychoactive substance after the rules for testing for psychoactive substances came into force in January 2022.

272.title: MBBS student found hanging dead in hostel in UP, CM orders probe
272.article_body: A first-year MBBS student was found hanging from the ceiling fan in his hostel room in Uttar Pradesh's Saifai Medical College on Saturday evening. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has ordered a probe asking the District Magistrate and Senior Superintendent of Police to submit a report on the student's death within 24 hours. No suicide note has been recovered yet.

273.title: Have solid blueprint on how to bring up my child with right values: Sonam
273.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who recently welcomed her first child, has said she has a "solid blueprint" on how to bring up her children with the right values. Speaking about parenting, she said, "It comes from watching the way Dad and Mum brought us up...their motto was equal parenting." She added her parents are partners "in every sense of the word".

274.title: EAM Jaishankar unveils bust of Mahatma Gandhi in Paraguay
274.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday unveiled the bust of Mahatma Gandhi in Paraguay's Asuncion. He said that he appreciated the municipality's decision to locate the bust at the city's prominent waterfront and added, "This is a statement of solidarity that was so strongly expressed during the COVID-19 pandemic." Jaishankar is on a six-day visit to South America.

275.title: Mumbai's Prince Aly Khan Hospital shuts in-patient service after declared unsafe
275.article_body: Mumbai's Prince Aly Khan Hospital has decided to shut its in-patient admissions and surgeries after an independent structural audit found that despite regular and timely maintenance, the main building was unsafe for occupancy. The hospital has been in operation since 1945. It is a 170-bed multi-speciality hospital that caters to more than 1,70,000 outpatients and 9,000 in-patients annually.

276.title: Heavy traffic jam near Ghazipur border due to farmers' protest today
276.article_body: Massive traffic jam was seen at the Ghazipur border in Delhi on Monday morning as police have put up checkpoints at the border due to Sanyukt Kisan Morcha's Mahapanchayat at Jantar Mantar today. Meanwhile, slow traffic movement was also reported at the Noida-Delhi Link Road at Chilla Border as security is beefed up at the border entry point to Delhi.

277.title: Harsh Goenka shares viral pic of wedding invite printed in form of medicine packaging
277.article_body: RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka shared a picture of a pharmacist's wedding invitation, which was printed in the form of medicine packaging. "People have become so innovative these days," Goenka wrote. The invite mentioned that the groom, B Ezhilarasan, is an Assistant Professor in a pharmacy college and the bride, M Vasanthakumari, is an Assistant Professor in a nursing college.

278.title: Death toll due to heavy rains, landslides rises to 27 in Himachal, several roads blocked
278.article_body: Death toll in Himachal Pradesh due to heavy rainfall and landslides has now risen to 27 after five more bodies were found. Several roads have also been damaged and blocked. Himachal Pradesh State Disaster Response Force took to Twitter to share updates about damaged roads in Kullu. Disaster Response Force shared video of machines working on damaged roads in Chamba.

279.title: US-S Korea begin biggest combined military training exercise in years
279.article_body: The US and South Korea have begun their biggest combined military training in years. The Ulchi Freedom Shield exercises reportedly include simulated joint attacks, front-line reinforcements of arms and fuel and removal of weapons of mass destruction. Last week, North Korea rejected South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's offer to make denuclearisation efforts in exchange for economic benefits.

280.title: Telangana Police are 'Razakar Police': T Raja after Faruqui's show
280.article_body: BJP leader Raja Singh criticised Telangana Police and called them "Razakar Police" for arresting BJP and BJYM leaders during Munawar Faruqui's show on Saturday. “The Hinduism in the police has died. They did not think their own Gods were insulted and all were busy providing security to a person, who insulted Lord Ram and Sita,” he said.

281.title: Shami can find a place in the XI for T20 WC if given chances: Karim
281.article_body: Ex-cricketer Saba Karim has said Mohammad Shami can surely find a place in Team India's playing XI for the T20 World Cup if pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who's currently undergoing rehabilitation at the NCA, is ruled out of the tournament. "Shami can surely find a place in the playing XI...if the selectors give him enough chances before the tournament," added Karim.

282.title: 7 houses damaged due to heavy rain in Himachal's Nurpur, families shifted
282.article_body: 7 houses were damaged due to heavy rains in Bariyara village of Nurpur in Himachal Pradesh on Sunday. The administration shifted the families to safe places, reports said. Meanwhile, death toll in Himachal Pradesh due to heavy rainfall and landslides has now risen to 27 after five more bodies were found. Several roads have also been damaged and blocked.

283.title: First made-in-India hydrogen fuel cell bus that only emits water unveiled in Pune
283.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh unveiled India's first indigenously developed hydrogen fuel cell bus in Pune on Sunday. The fuel cell utilises hydrogen and air to generate electricity to power the bus and the only effluent from the bus is water, Singh said. This possibly makes the hydrogen fuel cell bus the most environmentally friendly mode of transportation, the minister added.

284.title: India reports 9,531 new COVID-19 cases, active cases decline to 97,648
284.article_body: India has reported 9,531 new COVID-19 cases and 36 deaths in the last 24 hours including 10 reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Health Ministry. Active cases in the country went down to 97,648, while the daily positivity rate stood at 4.15%. India reported 11,726 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 4,37,23,944.

285.title: Working for India where children, youth get respect: BJP MP Varun Gandhi
285.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Sunday said he is working for an India where children and youth get respect and where nobody is compelled to bow his head for help. "Until employment ceases to exist in this country and your children don't get jobs, my 'sangharsh' (fight) will continue," Varun added while addressing a program in UP's Pilibhit.

286.title: Monkey snatches IAS officer's glasses in UP; video shows police trying to retrieve them
286.article_body: A monkey snatched and ran away with IAS officer and Mathura DM Navneet Chahal's spectacles in Vrindavan, a video of which is going viral on social media. Several police personnel could be seen trying to retrieve the glasses from the monkey without scaring it away and finally returning them to the DM in the video.

287.title: Manchester United should drop Ronaldo, Rashford from team: Wayne Rooney
287.article_body: Manchester United's record goal-scorer Wayne Rooney has urged manager Erik ten Hag to drop both Cristiano Ronaldo and Marcus Rashford from the team. "[Against Brentford] Ronaldo looked like he needs time to get match fit...he [also] wants to leave the club...I'd let him," stated Rooney. "Rashford looks like he wants to be anywhere but on a football pitch," he added.

288.title: Central Railway to intensify ticket-checking drive in Mumbai AC locals: Officials
288.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) officials said that they will soon start an intensive ticket-checking drive in Mumbai's AC locals. Last week (from August 18 to August 20), ticket-checkers caught 548 passengers travelling in AC locals without tickets and fined them ₹1.7 lakh. Currently, the number of passengers travelling in AC locals per day is over 38,000, another official said.

289.title: 20-yr-old stabbed to death in road rage incident in Chandigarh, 4 arrested
289.article_body: A 20-year-old man was stabbed to death by four men over a road rage incident in Chandigarh's Sector 17/22 dividing road on Sunday morning. All four accused were arrested within five hours. The victim and his two friends were returning home from a party when they encountered the accused driving on the wrong side leading to an altercation, police said.

290.title: Singapore will decriminalise sex between men: PM Lee Hsien Loong
290.article_body: Singapore's PM Lee Hsien Loong announced on Sunday that the government will repeal Section 377A, a colonial-era law, and decriminalise sex between men. However, he also proposed to amend the Constitution to protect the definition of marriage as being between a man and a woman. "Private sexual behaviour between consenting adults does not raise any law-and-order issue," he said.

291.title: 13 arrested in connection with stone pelting on Bihar CM's convoy in Patna
291.article_body: A total of 13 accused have been arrested in connection with stone-pelting at the convoy of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, SSP Patna said. Stones were pelted at the Chief Minister's convoy in the state capital on Sunday. Kumar was not present in the convoy at the time of the incident. The glasses of many vehicles were broken during incident.

292.title: Litigation is like bleeding wound: Justice Lalit on legal aid to poor
292.article_body: Litigation is like a bleeding wound and the more it's allowed to bleed, the more will the man suffer, Justice UU Lalit said. Over 70% of population is below the poverty line and only 12% opt for free legal aid provided by legal services authorities, he stated. He was formally launching the LADC system in 365 District Legal Services Authorities.

293.title: Gem of Telugu cinema: Home Minister Amit Shah after meeting Jr NTR
293.article_body: 'RRR' actor Jr NTR met Home Minister Amit Shah in Hyderabad on Sunday. Taking to Twitter, the Home Minister shared pictures of the interaction and wrote, "Had a good interaction with a very talented actor and the gem of our Telugu cinema, Jr NTR in Hyderabad." In response to the tweet, Jr NTR wrote, "It was a pleasure meeting you."

294.title: Govt blocked YouTube midway through my speech: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan
294.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday claimed that the government temporarily blocked YouTube midway through his speech. "This just shows the desperation of those who for their self interest are willing to push Pakistan towards political and economic chaos," he said. Earlier, Pakistan's media watchdog banned live broadcast of Khan's speeches after he threatened police officials and a magistrate.

295.title: Delhi Traffic Police issue advisory in view of Sanyukt Kisan Morcha's Mahapanchayat
295.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police have issued a traffic advisory in view of Sanyukt Kisan Morcha's Mahapanchayat at Jantar Mantar today. Taking to Twitter, the Delhi Traffic Police requested commuters to plan their journeys in advance. The police also shared a list of roads, including Tolstoy Marg, Sansad Marg, Ashoka Road and Pandit Pant Marg, that are likely to be congested today.

296.title: Organisers of public Ganeshotsav require prior permission from BBMP
296.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has allowed public Ganeshotsav celebrations in the city this year on the condition that the organisers of Ganeshotsav in public places will have to get no objection certificate (NOC) from BBMP beforehand. The civic body has decided to go ahead with a single-window agency to provide permission for organising Ganeshotsav, BBMP Chief Commissioner said.

297.title: Boy who left Lonavala home 8 months ago to escape abusive relatives found
297.article_body: A 12-year-old boy, who had gone missing from his Lonavala home eight months ago, has been found. Probe revealed he had left home because his paternal aunt and uncle used to beat him sometimes. He earlier told investigators that he was drugged and when he woke up, he was in Delhi. Process of reuniting him with his grandmother has started.

298.title: Security tightened in Delhi over farmer protest at Jantar Mantar
298.article_body: Delhi Police has tightened the security at Singhu border and Ghazipur border on the Delhi-Meerut expressway. The Samyukt Kisan Morcha has called for a ‘mahapanchayat’ at Delhi’s Jantar Mantar against unemployment in the country. It is expected to be attended by farmers from different states, however, Delhi Police said it has denied permission for the protest.

299.title: Zomato suspends its 'Pro' and 'Pro Plus' membership programmes
299.article_body: Zomato has stopped onboarding new members and merchant partners to 'Pro' and 'Pro Plus' programmes, the food delivery company confirmed to The Indian Express. Zomato said that active members will not be able to extend or renew their memberships once their membership tenure expires. Zomato offered discounts to 'Pro' and 'Pro Plus' members while ordering food online or dining out.

300.title: I'll try to do best I can as mother, acting will take backseat: Sonam
300.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who recently welcomed her first child with her husband Anand Ahuja, said, "I'll try to do the best I can as a mother, which means...acting will definitely take a backseat." However, she added she will not stop working completely. Sonam, who had last featured in the 2020 film 'AK vs AK', will next be seen in 'Blind'.

301.title: Hero Vired offers Full Stack Development program with assured placement
301.article_body: Hero Vired, in partnership with Codecademy, offers a Certificate Program in Full Stack Development with Cloud for Web & Mobile. The immersive web development program explores concepts of building applications and is designed for professionals & freshers interested in pursuing a career in app development, it shared. It includes placement assurance and 70+ live sessions with global & Indian faculty.

302.title: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeats world number one Carlsen again
302.article_body: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in his last match at FTX Crypto Cup in Miami. This year, Praggnanandhaa had also defeated Carlsen at the Airthings Masters in February and at Chessable Masters in May. Praggnanandhaa finished FTX Crypto Cup as the runner-up with 15 points, while Carlsen won the tournament with 16 points.

303.title: Filmfare withdraws Kangana's nomination, calls her accusations false; actress responds
303.article_body: Filmfare has withdrawn Kangana Ranaut's award nomination after she said she'd sue the magazine for nominating and inviting her. Calling her accusations against the award show false, Filmfare said, "We reserve all rights to pursue any legal action against her...defamatory statements." Responding to Filmfare, Kangana said, "My endeavour is to...stop such malicious award shows...see you in court."

304.title: Video of murder accused cutting birthday cake inside police van in Maharashtra goes viral
304.article_body: A video of a 28-year-old murder accused, Roshan Jha, celebrating his birthday in a police van in Kalyan, has went viral on social media. His followers handed over a cake to him from the window of the van and he cut it. "The team who was given the responsibility to produce Jha in court is facing an inquiry," officials said.

305.title: Pankaj taught me to sit, do dead eyes, open mouth expression: Alia on 'Udta...'
305.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said actor Pankaj Tripathi helped her prepare for the movie 'Udta Punjab'. "He taught me to sit and speak the way the natives do. Then he made me do lot of acting workshops, how to loosen the body, a certain expression which is dead eyes, open mouth," she said, adding she attended different workshops on body language.

306.title: BMC to build 162 ponds for Ganesh idol immersions in Mumbai
306.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has planned to build 162 artificial ponds for Ganesh idol immersion in Mumbai. In addition, the civic body will deploy trucks with immersion facilities and idol collection centres in all 24 wards. BMC has also published its website – shreeganeshvisarjan.com – where citizens can submit their details and get guided about immersion times and places.

307.title: Salman made me fast photographer; he's impatient, didn't give time: Avinash
307.article_body: Celebrity photographer Avinash Gowariker has revealed that actor Salman Khan helped him become a "very fast" photographer. "Salman doesn't give too much time, he is impatient, he is spontaneous...He never used to give me time. He never had time for anything," he stated. Avinash further added that Salman would shoot only when he wanted to.

308.title: Found out about pregnancy on Christmas Day, told Anand over Zoom call: Sonam
308.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor said it was Christmas Day when she found out that she was pregnant. "Anand was in the other room of our London apartment since he had Covid and I basically Zoomed him and gave him the news. Then we called our parents and told them as well," she added. They welcomed their baby boy on August 20.

309.title: Man Utd manager forces players to watch videos of City, Liverpool: Report
309.article_body: Manchester United manager Erik Ten Hag has reportedly forced his players to watch videos of Manchester City, Liverpool and Chelsea. Ten Hag has also reportedly told his players to tell their families that they would "get in early and go home late". The manager has conveyed the message that no player is a guaranteed starter.

310.title: Centre accepts nearly all FIFA demands in its fresh SC application
310.article_body: The central government has moved an application in the Supreme Court, stating that it is ready to end to the "mandate" of the Committee of Administrators as demanded by FIFA. The application accepted nearly all of FIFA's demands including the one to not allow individual members in the electoral college. FIFA on August 15 imposed a ban on the AIFF.

311.title: Govt to name all AIIMS after freedom fighters, monuments: Reports
311.article_body: The Centre has decided to give individual names to all 23 All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) across the country, reports said. They will reportedly be named after freedom fighters, regional heroes, historical events, notable monuments or their distinct geographical identities. The Union Health Ministry has asked the institutes to give suggestions for the names, PTI reported.

312.title: Rajasthan logs 402 fresh COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths
312.article_body: Rajasthan recorded 402 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths due to the infection in the last 24 hours, state health department officials informed on Sunday. The state's active caseload stood at 4,244, according to the department. Jaipur recorded 123 of the 402 new cases, while 66 cases were logged in Bharatpur. Ajmer, Bharatpur, Jaipur, and Karauli reported one fatality each.

313.title: Suit-boot-loot sarkar: Rahul Gandhi says BJP cuts taxes for 'Mitron'
313.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi tweeted that the BJP-led central government was "suit-boot-loot sarkar" as it imposed higher taxes on people and lower taxes on corporates. Rahul shared a graph and said, "Raise taxes on people, cut taxes for Mitron (friends)- the 'natural course' of action for suit-boot-loot sarkar." On Saturday, Congress said writing off loans was the "real freebie".

314.title: Chelsea ban supporter after Tottenham's Son gets racially abused
314.article_body: Chelsea have banned a season ticket holder indefinitely after Tottenham Hotspur's Son Heung-min was reportedly racially abused during last weekend's Premier League game. The incident reportedly took place when the South Korean player went to take a corner in the second half of the match. The English club said that it finds any form of discriminatory behaviour "totally abhorrent".

315.title: Delhi-bound man arrested at Cochin airport with drugs worth ₹60 cr
315.article_body: A Kerala man was arrested at the Cochin Airport with drugs worth around ₹60 crore as he arrived from Zimbabwe via Doha. Authorities say the Delhi-bound Palakkad-native had nearly 30 kg of metha quinol drug in a concealed compartment of his bag. The man was handed over to the narcotics department and the drugs were sent for testing.

316.title: Du Plessis' experience will be invaluable in CSA T20 league: CSK-owned franchise
316.article_body: CSK CEO KS Viswanathan said Faf Du Plessis' experience as South African player and captain and knowing the conditions will be invaluable for the CSK-owned Johannesburg franchise in inaugural edition of Cricket South Africa (CSA) T20 league. "I'm sure that with his entry into...team, we should've a good future," he added. Ex-CSK player Du Plessis was bought by Johannesburg franchise.

317.title: Too young to retire, having so much fun: Red Bull F1's Sergio Perez
317.article_body: Red Bull F1 driver Sergio Perez said he is too young to retire after his contract ends in 2024. "I'm too young for that and still have too much fun...Formula 1 becomes your life. And you can't just leave that behind," said the 32-year-old. Earlier, team boss Christian Horner said Perez would have to consistently perform to extend his contract.

318.title: Pakistani singer Nayyara Noor passes away aged 71
318.article_body: Pakistani singer Nayyara Noor passed away aged 71 on Sunday after a brief illness. As per reports, she was undergoing treatment for quite some time in Karachi. Remembering Noor, her nephew Raza Zaidi tweeted, "She was given the title of 'Bulbul-e-Pakistan' because of her melodious voice." Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif also mourned Nayyara's death.

319.title: Leeds United beat 10-man Chelsea 3-0, remain unbeaten in Premier League
319.article_body: Leeds United continued their unbeaten start to the Premier League season after defeating 10-man Chelsea 3-0 on Sunday. Brenden Aaronson, Rodrigo Moreno and Jack Harrison's goals helped Leeds win at Elland Road. With two wins from three matches, Leeds are currently third in the standings. Notably, it is Leeds' first league win against Chelsea since 2002.

320.title: Advocates must ensure litigants' justice within specified time: CM Bommai
320.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that advocates must endeavour to provide justice for their litigants within the time frame specified. "The true goal of the judiciary is to secure justice for the common man," CM Bommai said. He added, "The digitalisation has activated the judicial system. The advocates' verdicts and arguments have been digitalised."

321.title: Video shows Putin's aide's reaction at scene of daughter's car bombing
321.article_body: A video of Russian President Vladimir Putin's aide Alexander Dugin reacting to his daughter's car exploding has surfaced online. The video shows Dugin standing with his hands to his head at the scene of the bombing. As per reports, there is speculation that the bomb that killed Darya Dugina was meant for Dugin.

322.title: Casey missed Ben-Jennifer's wedding due to 'parental obligations': Reports
322.article_body: Ben Affleck's brother and actor Casey Affleck has reportedly missed Ben and Jennifer Lopez's wedding celebrations. As per reports, he couldn't attend the ceremony "because of family, parental obligations at home". Ben and Jennifer got married for the second time in attendance of their family and friends at Ben's riverfront estate in Georgia.

323.title: Not fascinated by being remembered: Vijay Deverakonda
323.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda said he is "happy being forgotten" and understands that after a point of time, "nobody remembers" anyone's legacy. The actor said he "should vacate space" for the newcomers to be "loved and worshipped" by the audience. He said, after his retirement, he will switch back to a life of not being in the public eye with ease.

324.title: Guardiola to speak with Man City regarding future after World Cup
324.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said that he will speak to the club about his future after the 2022 FIFA World Cup. "When you play every three days, it's like eating spaghetti every day...maybe taking a break is good," said Guardiola. He has spent six years at City, his longest tenure with a club, and has a contract till 2025.

325.title: Expect exciting three-way battles: Hulkenberg on remaining F1 season
325.article_body: Aston Martin F1 driver Nico Hulkenberg said Mercedes has been "successfully" working hard to ensure they match Ferrari and Red Bull in the second half of the season. "I am sure that the field will be even closer...we can expect some exciting three-way battles," said Hulkenberg. He said there could also be closer battles in the midfield going forward.

326.title: Research needed to help women athletes during menstrual cycles: Jhulan Goswami
326.article_body: India Women fast bowler Jhulan Goswami has said that research is needed to help women athletes during menstrual cycles. "When I was young, I couldn’t even discuss this topic. I would just keep it to myself, not tell coaches, quietly fighting through it," she added. "We can’t give excuses and sit," she further stated.

327.title: Pakistan-born man arrested by Rajasthan Police on spying charges
327.article_body: Rajasthan Police has arrested a 46-year-old man identified as Bhagchand from Delhi for allegedly spying for Pakistan. Bhagchand, a Pakistan-born, was granted Indian citizenship in 2016, police said. The accused used to supply Indian SIM cards and mobile numbers to his handlers, police said. He also allegedly helped his handlers in operating social media accounts using Indian numbers.

328.title: Leopard dies as water enters Zoological Park in Jamshedpur
328.article_body: A 17-year-old male leopard died after water entered the low-lying areas of the Tata Steel Zoological Park, especially the area near the leopard enclosure, due to incessant rains in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur. The leopard, Mithun, was released into the display area so that he could climb to some safer place but couldn't make it owing to his old age, officials said.

329.title: 'Modern Family' star Sarah marries actor Wells Adams years after meeting on Twitter
329.article_body: 'Modern Family' star Sarah Hyland tied the knot with 'The Bachelorette' star Wells Adams on Saturday, five years after meeting for the first time through Twitter. The duo had got engaged in July 2019. Sarah's former co-stars Jesse Tyler Ferguson, Nolan Gould and Sofia Vergara attended the wedding. The wedding took place in California.

330.title: Attack planned on Kejriwal, Sisodia: Gujarat AAP to police
330.article_body: AAP has sought security from the Gujarat DGP for Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia when they visit Gujarat from Monday onward. "A few anti-social elements inspired by the ideology of the ruling party are planning to attack," said AAP in their application. A team of 50 lawyers approached the DGP's office with the application.

331.title: Mobile internet snapped in 24 Assam districts for govt job exams
331.article_body: The Assam government on Sunday shut down mobile internet services in 24 districts to prevent cheating or question paper leakage as recruitment examinations were conducted for Grade III posts in 48 state government departments. Services were snapped from 10am-12pm and 2pm-4pm. The government will take similar measures on August 28 for written exams for Grade IV jobs.

332.title: Deepika Padukone to make a cameo in SRK's 'Jawan': Reports
332.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone will reportedly make a special appearance in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie 'Jawan', which is being directed by Atlee. A video has surfaced showing Deepika arriving in Chennai for the shoot of the film. She will reportedly play Shah Rukh's wife in the film. The actors will also be seen together in Siddharth Anand's 'Pathaan'.

333.title: She didn’t talk to me for 3 weeks: Elba on daughter's rejection for ‘Beast’
333.article_body: Actor Idris Elba said his daughter Isan had auditioned for a role in his film 'Beast' but she did not get the part. "The relationship in the film and the relationship between my daughter was, the chemistry wasn't right for the film, weirdly enough," Elba said. He recalled his daughter didn't speak to him "for about three weeks" after rejection.

334.title: IKEA to open small outlets along with mega stores in India
334.article_body: IKEA is planning to open small outlets in cities along with mega format stores in India supported by an online channel, a senior company official said. The company is planning to change its strategy due to changing consumer behaviours. IKEA received the government's approval in 2013 for its ₹10,500 crore investment to open its stores in India.

335.title: CP Rizwan, UAE's captain for Asia Cup qualifiers, is an electrical engineer from Kerala
335.article_body: CP Rizwan, who replaced Ahmed Raza as captain of UAE for Asia Cup 2022 qualifiers, is an electrical engineer from Kerala. He hails from Thalassery and has represented Kerala in Under-19 Cooch Behar Trophy and he was a part of Kerala's Under-23 team. After residing in UAE for four years, Rizwan made his debut for his adopted country in 2019.

336.title: Neeraj Chopra is not 100% fit yet but improving: AFI president
336.article_body: Athletics Federation of India (AFI) President Adille Sumariwalla said javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra is "not 100 per cent fit yet" but has shown improvement. He was replying to whether Neeraj would be able to participate in the Lausanne Diamond League starting on August 26. Neeraj had missed the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham due to a groin strain.

337.title: Don't take Kohli easy: Yasir ahead of India-Pakistan game at Asia Cup 2022
337.article_body: Pakistan spinner Yasir Shah said batter Virat Kohli shouldn't be taken lightly ahead of the team's group stage match against India at Asia Cup 2022. "Yes, he's not in form because he's struggling to score runs, but he's a world-class player...he can come back to form at any time," he added. Kohli hasn't scored an international century since November 2019.

338.title: Govt awards GI tag to 'Mithila Makhana'
338.article_body: The government has awarded the Geographical Indication (GI) tag to Mithila Makhana. “Mithila Makhana registered with GI Tag, farmers will get profit and it will be easier to earn. Due to Geographical Indication Tag to Mithila Makhana in the festive season, people outside Bihar will be able to use this auspicious material with reverence,” Union Minister Piyush Goyal tweeted.

339.title: Imran Khan booked for threatening Pak judge & police, will reportedly be arrested
339.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan was on Sunday booked under the anti-terror act, a day after he allegedly threatened a judge and two top police officials at a public event. As per reports, the Pakistan government is preparing for his arrest. Khan had earlier allegedly threatened to file cases against government officials and his political rivals over his aide's arrest.

340.title: At least 16 dead after lorry crashes into minibus in Russia
340.article_body: At least 16 people were killed and three others were injured after a lorry collided with a stationary minibus in Russia's Ulyanovsk region on Sunday, according to local authorities. The minibus was crushed between two lorries, Ulyanovsk region's interior ministry said. The passenger vehicle was in a traffic jam due to roadworks at the incident site, as per the ministry.

341.title: Nitish Kumar's convoy attacked with stones, CM not present in cavalcade
341.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's convoy was attacked with stones in Patna on Sunday, but he was not present in any of the cars at the time of the incident. The glasses of many vehicles were broken. "A case has been registered against 15 people and police have already arrested 11 people," the Patna District Magistrate said.

342.title: Medical student found hanging inside hostel in UP's Etawah
342.article_body: A medical student was found hanging from a ceiling fan inside the hostel of the Saifai Medical College in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah. The deceased, Himanshu Gupta (19), was a first-year MBBS student and a resident of Gorakhpur, police said. Notably, Gupta's mother claimed that there were injury marks on her son's body and alleged it to be a murder case.

343.title: India to buy predator drones worth $3 bn from US for use along China border: Report
343.article_body: India is in an 'advanced stage' of talks with the US to buy predator drones for over $3 billion to increase surveillance along the Line of Actual Control with China and in the Indian Ocean region, PTI reported. An executive of US firm General Atomics said deal talks for acquiring the MQ-9B drones are underway between the two governments.

344.title: Pitted against mediocre work: Kangana on being nominated with Vidya & others
344.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, taking to her Instagram Stories, called those nominated alongside her at the Filmfare Awards 2022 "mediocre". "[They're] making desperate blackmailing calls to attend awards after [being] pitted against mediocre work," she wrote. In addition to Kangana, Kiara Advani, Kriti Sanon, Parineeti Chopra, Taapsee Pannu and Vidya Balan have been nominated in the Best Actress category.

345.title: Wore burqa to 'Dear Comrade' screening: Vijay Deverakonda
345.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda, who will soon be seen in 'Liger', revealed that he once attended a screening of his Telugu film, 'Dear Comrade', in a burqa. "Sometimes what I do is I wear...burqa and I go into theatres to sit among...audience. If you see a burqa-clad tall person, it could be me," he added. 'Dear Comrade' was released in 2019.

346.title: Dubai's Emaar Properties to sell fashion firm Namshi for $335.2 mn
346.article_body: Dubai's Emaar Properties said its board has approved the sale of fashion firm Namshi to e-commerce company Noon which is backed by Dubai billionaire Mohamed Alabbar and the Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund. Emaar bought Namshi for $281 million after first acquiring a 51% in 2017 before buying the remaining 49% in 2019. Noon will be sold for $335.2 million.

347.title: I get a lot of strength looking at her: Mahima on working with Kangana
347.article_body: Actress Mahima Chaudhry, who will be seen alongside Kangana Ranaut in the upcoming movie 'Emergency', has said she gets a lot of strength looking at her and the way she functions. "She wears so many hats with such great ease," Mahima added. Kangana will be directing and producing the film in addition to acting in it.

348.title: Cong invisible for 5 yrs, comes with posters before polls: Gujarat BJP
348.article_body: The Chief Spokesperson of the BJP's Gujarat unit, Yamal Vyas, has commented on the Congress' strategy ahead of the Assembly elections in the state. "Congress was invisible in the state for the last 5 years and just before elections have come up with these posters and the things that they will get votes with," Vyas said.

349.title: Will protest if we don't get justice for my son: Moosewala's mother
349.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's mother on Sunday said she and her husband will start a protest if they don't get justice for their son, claiming that the real culprits were not yet behind bars. "More than three months have passed, we have given enough time to government and administration, but they are taking undue advantage of our gentleness," she said.

350.title: Suriya’s next with director Siruthai Siva goes on floors
