350.article_body: Actor Suriya's next with director Siruthai Siva has gone on floors today. The film, which is tentatively titled 'Suriya 42', marks the actor's first collaboration with Siva. As per reports, the film will see Bollywood actress Disha Patani making her Tamil film debut opposite Suriya. The makers will reportedly shoot an extensive schedule of the film in Goa.

351.title: 14-yr-old beaten by autorickshaw driver for resisting rape in J'khand
351.article_body: An autorickshaw driver brutally beat and threw a 14-year-old girl away in a lonely place in a semi-unconscious state for resisting a rape attempt in Jharkhand's Dumka district, police said on Sunday. The accused tried to flirt with the victim and another girl, who was already sitting in his autorickshaw, but the other girl escaped, the release said.

352.title: UAE to reinstate ambassador to Iran 6 years after downgrading ties
352.article_body: UAE said on Sunday that it would reinstate its ambassador to Iran "in coming days". The move is in line with efforts to strengthen relations with Iran "to achieve common interests of the two countries and the wider region", UAE's foreign ministry said. UAE had downgraded ties with Iran in 2016 after Saudi Arabia broke ties with the latter.

353.title: Pa Ranjith's next to be about love between homosexuals & transgenders
353.article_body: Tamil director Pa Ranjith said his film 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu' is about love, a word which as per him has been changed into "a political term" by the society. He said the society interlinks love with caste and community, an issue that the film will explore. He said the film will also talk about love between homosexuals and transgenders.

354.title: Harry Kane is a player who makes the difference: Antonio Conte
354.article_body: After striker Harry Kane set a Premier League record as the highest goalscorer (185) for a single club, Tottenham Hotspur's manager Antonio Conte said that the 29-year-old footballer is a "player who makes the difference". "We're talking about a really world-class striker who can be dangerous in all aspects...He's (Kane) always ready to help...[and] work for the team," Conte added.

355.title: Wimbledon champ Rybakina's father reveals she wanted to quit tennis 6 months ago
355.article_body: Wimbledon champion Elena Rybakina's father Andrey Rybakin revealed that his daughter, who became the first-ever Kazakh player to win a Grand Slam singles title, wanted to quit tennis six months ago. "Many tennis players go through this (quitting)...Even just before Wimbledon, it was like that…we talked with her in…family for…six days. My daughter calmed down…began to train again," he added.

356.title: Jaipur Police bust illegal gambling racket; 84 arrested including inspector
356.article_body: The police busted an illegal gambling racket in a resort in the Jaisinghpura Khor area of Jaipur and arrested 84 people, including 13 women. Notably, a police inspector of the Karnataka Police and a Tehsildar posted in Bengaluru were among the 84 arrested people. Around 14 luxury cars, one truck and ₹23.78 lakh in cash were also recovered, police said.

357.title: Woman who abused Noida society guard sent to 14-day judicial custody
357.article_body: A woman in Noida who was arrested for allegedly misbehaving with a security guard of Jaypee Wish Town society in Noida has been sent to 14-day judicial custody. The woman allegedly argued with the guard over the delay in opening the gates. As per another security guard who recorded the incident's video, she started shouting and hurling abuses.

358.title: We'll step in to protect Serbs in Kosovo if NATO doesn't: Serbia Prez
358.article_body: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic called on NATO on Sunday to "do their job" and protect the Serbian community in Kosovo or else Serbia itself will move to protect its minority there. Albanian "gangs" need to be stopped from crossing into northern Kosovo, where most of the Kosovo Serbs live, Vucic further said. Kosovo declared independence from Serbia in 2008.

359.title: China ignored pacts: Jaishankar on reason for 'difficult phase' in Indo-China relations
359.article_body: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar on Sunday said that it's "no secret" India-China relations are undergoing a "difficult phase". "[This is] mainly because we had agreements with China, going back to the 1990s, which prohibit bringing massive troops into the prohibited areas. They've disregarded that," said Jaishankar.

360.title: Federer shares video of practising on court ahead of comeback at Laver Cup 2022
360.article_body: Roger Federer took to Instagram to share a video of himself wherein he's seen practising on the court ahead of his comeback at Laver Cup 2022. The 20-time Grand Slam champion had confirmed that he'll be playing for the first time at Laver Cup since his Wimbledon 2021 quarter-final loss. The tournament will be held in London from September 23-25.

361.title: Army arrests Pakistani intruder near LoC in J&K's Rajouri district
361.article_body: The Indian Army arrested a Pakistani intruder near the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Sunday. Officials said no incriminating materials have been recovered from the intruder so far. The intruder is currently being treated in a medical facility after army personnel opened fire noticing suspicious movement from across the border in the Nowshera sector.

362.title: No Look Out Circular issued against Sisodia in excise policy scam yet: CBI officials
362.article_body: CBI officials on Sunday refuted reports that Look Out Circulars were issued against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and others in the excise policy scam case. The officials said that the process of scrutinising documents is going on and notices are being issued to suspects for questioning. Responding to reports, Sisodia said he is roaming freely in Delhi.

363.title: No consideration to levy any charges for UPI services: Govt on reports
363.article_body: After reports surfaced that the government is planning to impose extra charges to be paid for every UPI payment, the Ministry of Finance said, "There is no consideration in Govt to levy any charges for UPI services." It added, "The concerns of the service providers for cost recovery have to be met through other means."

364.title: 2 Assam imams arrested over alleged links with Al-Qaeda affiliate
364.article_body: Two imams with suspected links to Al Qaida in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) and the Bangladesh-based terror group Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT) have been arrested in Assam's Goalpara district, police said on Sunday. Their names surfaced after the arrest of one Abbas Ali in July. In Assam, more than 23 individuals have been arrested in recent months over alleged terror links.

365.title: I am trending on Twitter but why: Mohammad Amir after Shaheen gets ruled out of Asia Cup
365.article_body: After Shaheen Afridi got ruled out of Asia Cup 2022 due to injury, Pakistani fast bowler Mohammad Amir tweeted, "I am trending on Twitter but why?" Mohammad Amir had announced his retirement from international cricket aged 28 in December 2020 due to the then PCB management. "People want you to be a part of Asia Cup," a Twitter user wrote.

366.title: Punjab to reserve law officer posts for Scheduled Caste persons
366.article_body: The Punjab government has announced reservation for Scheduled Caste (SC) persons in law officer posts in the state government. Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said 58 new law officer posts were being created for the same in the Advocate General's office. He added that Punjab will be the first to have such a provision for lawyers from the SC community.

367.title: Underdogs don't give up: UK PM hopeful Rishi Sunak in campaign video
367.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak has released a campaign video, which terms him an "underdog", two weeks before the Conservative Party leadership poll is set to draw to a close. "They say beware [of] the underdog, because an underdog has...nothing to lose...underdogs don't give up," the voiceover in the video says. The election's results will be announced on September 5.

368.title: If rape convicts can be freed, why not Sikh prisoners: SGPC chief
368.article_body: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee President Harjinder Dhami alleged that the Centre was adopting a discriminatory policy towards Sikhs. "On one side...the government is releasing convicts of...rape...while on the other side, Sikh prisoners are kept lodged in jails for three decades," Dhami said. Recently, the Gujarat government released 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case.

369.title: Bodies of woman, her 2 children found in a pond in Assam
369.article_body: After missing from their house since Saturday, the bodies of a 30-year-old woman and her two children were found in a pond in Assam's Nagaon district on Sunday. The deceased woman, Niru Bordoloi, and her two children were residents of the district's Madhya Tupakuchi village, police said. Notably, police are probing the reason behind their death.

370.title: Man slaps woman toll booth worker when asked to pay toll in MP; video surfaces
370.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows a man slapping a woman toll booth worker on being asked to pay toll in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh. The woman hit him back with her footwear. The incident took place when the man claimed that he was a local and should be exempted from paying the toll charges. He didn't have any supporting documents.

371.title: I've boring life, what will you ask: Taapsee on not being part of 'Koffee...'
371.article_body: Taapsee Pannu, opening up about not being invited to 'Koffee With Karan', said, "I've...boring life, what will you ask?" She added all exciting part of her life is out in open. "But that's not exciting enough...[for]...that kind of show," she added. In an earlier interview, Taapsee jokingly said her sex life wasn't interesting enough to be invited to the show.

372.title: Pak must capitalise on India's premier pacers missing out in Asia Cup: Nawaz
372.article_body: Ahead of upcoming India-Pakistan group stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Sarfraz Nawaz said Pakistan should capitalise on India's bowling attack as their premier pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami are missing out. He added that Pakistan should replicate the same result (win) from the T20 World Cup last year. The match will be played on August 28 in Dubai.

373.title: Pope calls for talks to resolve Church-govt crisis in Nicaragua
373.article_body: Pope Francis on Sunday called for an "open and sincere" dialogue to resolve the ongoing conflict between the Church and government in Nicaragua. This comes following the arrest of Bishop Rolando Alvarez, an influential figure of the Nicaraguan Church. Alvarez is seen as a leading critic of President Daniel Ortega. Several priests have been detained in Nicaragua in recent months.

374.title: Ex-CEO of OML which organises NH7 Weekender, raided over Delhi excise policy scam
374.article_body: Only Much Louder's (OML) ex-CEO Vijay Nair has said his Mumbai home was raided by CBI in connection to Delhi excise policy scam in which Deputy CM Manish Sisodia is an accused. OML organises NH7 Weekender concerts and managed AlB. Rejecting reports that he fled the country, he said, "I spoke to CBI officers who were present at my residence."

375.title: Nepotism claims in university appointments to be probed: Kerala Guv
375.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan on Sunday said that he will order a full-fledged investigation into allegations of nepotism in appointments made to various posts in state universities. Earlier this week, Khan stayed the appointment of Kerala CM's private secretary KK Ragesh's wife as a Kannur University associate professor. She has been accused of landing the job through unfair means.

376.title: Ranveer Singh seeks 2 weeks' time to appear before Mumbai Police in nude photoshoot case
376.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who was summoned by Mumbai Police to record his statement on August 22 in connection with an FIR registered against him over his nude photoshoot, has sought more time from the police. "The actor has sought two weeks' time to appear, now fresh summons will be sent...after fixing a new date," Mumbai Police stated.

377.title: Army guys are pissed with the movie: Meera Chopra on Aamir's 'Laal...'
377.article_body: Actress Meera Chopra, Priyanka Chopra's cousin, spoke about Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and said, "I have a problem with [the film] on fundamental issues." She added that whatever the film "showed against the Army was not cool". "Talk to Army guys, they are pissed with the movie. I come from an Army family," Meera further said.

378.title: RSS working to make India a model society for whole world: Bhagwat
378.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said that the organisation is working to awaken and unify the society so that India can emerge as a "model society for the entire world". "We need to prioritise us above 'my and mine' while doing welfare work and this will help us evolve as a society," Bhagwat said at an event in Delhi.

379.title: S Lanka aims to get 10 lakh tourists this year, most from India: Minister
379.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's economic crisis, the country's Tourism Minister Harin Fernando on Saturday said that the government aims to receive at least 10 lakh tourists this year, mostly from India. Fernando added that religious and cultural tourism between Sri Lanka and India "will make a lot of sense". Sri Lanka is currently receiving approximately 2,000 tourists per day, he said.

380.title: It could be due to workload: Javed on Shaheen's injury ahead of Asia Cup
380.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Aaqib Javed said Shaheen Shah Afridi's knee injury ahead of Asia Cup 2022 could be due to workload as the Pakistan pacer has been playing continuously. "Team management should deal with patience. Do not panic in this situation and let Shaheen recover completely," he added. Shaheen sustained the injury during the first Test against Sri Lanka in Galle.

381.title: Whole country wants to see Kejriwal as the next PM: Sisodia
381.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal becoming the next PM is not an individual's ambition, but the whole country wants it, Deputy Delhi CM Manish Sisodia said on Sunday. "People see Kejriwal as an alternative to Modi in 2024 because he talks about health, education and employment," said Sisodia. BJP and CBI have a motive to stop Kejriwal, Sisodia added.

382.title: Police allow murder accused to meet girlfriend in K'taka lodge, booked
382.article_body: The police allegedly allowed a murder accused, who was brought to court for a hearing, to spend time with his girlfriend at a lodge in Karnataka's Dharwad on Saturday, following which the policemen were booked. The accused policemen acted like guards and protected the room, reports said. Vidyagiri Police raided the room where the murder accused was staying.

383.title: Somali forces end 30-hour siege at hotel, over 20 people killed
383.article_body: Somali authorities on Sunday ended a deadly 30-hour-long siege by gunmen at a hotel in Mogadishu, in which over 20 people were killed and many others were left wounded. The attack, which began on Friday evening, had started with loud explosions. "During the attack, the security forces rescued many civilians trapped in the hotel, including...children," a police official said.

384.title: Industries can make startups more result-oriented: Jitendra Singh
384.article_body: Union Minister of state for Science and Technology, Dr Jitendra Singh, said that to make the Indian startup ecosystem more result-oriented, industries should partner with startups. Dr Singh added that for the ecosystem to be sustainable, academia institutions need to link each stage with the industry. He said that the science and technology department can provide liberal funding to startups.

385.title: Telugu actor Junior NTR to meet Union Minister Amit Shah over dinner
385.article_body: 'RRR' actor Junior NTR will meet Union Home Minister Amit Shah over dinner on Sunday. Shah is in Telangana to address a public rally in the state's Nalgonda district. The actor is among several prominent personalities scheduled to meet Shah at Ramoji Film City. Junior NTR is the grandson of Telugu Desam Party (TDP) founder NT Rama Rao.

386.title: IndiGo pilots declare 'Mayday' after false smoke warning in Delhi-Kolkata flight
386.article_body: The pilots of a Delhi-Kolkata IndiGo flight on Sunday declared 'Mayday' (the international radio distress signal used by ships and aircraft) following a smoke warning that turned out to be fake, officials said. Pilots of flight 6E-2513 asked Kolkata ATC for a priority landing after a warning of smoke in the cargo area. The flight was safely landed.

387.title: Pegasus spyware maker NSO Group's CEO Shalev Hulio steps down
387.article_body: NSO Group, the maker of the Pegasus spyware, announced that its Chief Executive Officer Shalev Hulio is stepping down with immediate effect. The company has appointed Chief Operating Officer Yaron Shohat to oversee the company's reorganisation and will also lead the company till a successor is named. As part of its reorganisation, the company will reportedly fire around 100 employees.

388.title: We don't influence share prices: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma
388.article_body: Paytm MD and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma told shareholders that the company has no influence on stock prices, however, the management is making efforts to make the firm profitable. "Macro, micro, international investors, and several other sentiments play a role in share prices," Sharma said. Paytm will post operational profit in the quarter ending September 2023, he added.

389.title: Shameful & disturbing: Shiv Sena MP on Noida woman abusing guard
389.article_body: After a video showed a woman abusing a security guard in a residential society in Noida, Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi said it is disturbing and shameful. "Using classist slurs and abusing people of a state is criminal and shameful, hope UP police ensures she is punished for this behaviour," Chaturvedi added. The woman also pushed the guard.

390.title: Chiranjeevi's 'Bholaa Shankar' to release on April 14, 2023
390.article_body: Ahead of Tollywood actor Chiranjeevi's birthday, the makers of 'Bholaa Shankar' announced the film's release date. Taking to Twitter, director Meher Ramesh shared that the film will release worldwide on April 14, 2023. "Wishing the swagster of Indian cinema a very happy birthday," his tweet read. 'Bholaa Shankar' also stars Keerthy Suresh and Tamannaah Bhatia.

391.title: Video of Dalit man being beaten with slippers in UP surfaces, village head among 2 held
391.article_body: A video of a Dalit man being beaten with slippers by two men in UP's Muzaffarnagar district has surfaced. As per reports, the Dalit man had made some comments about the village head. The duo were called by a former village head to his house, where the Dalit man was beaten by the two. Police have arrested the two accused.

392.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia are 'twin towers of corruption': BJP spokesperson
392.article_body: Posing questions to AAP on the excise policy scam, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla on Sunday called AAP leaders Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia "the twin towers of corruption". Through a series of tweets, Poonawalla posed several questions, including, "Is it not true that an illegal waiver was given to the liquor mafia of ₹144 crore?"

393.title: 17-yr-old dies by suicide after losing PUBG game in Bihar
393.article_body: A 17-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide on Friday night, after losing a game of PUBG in Bihar's Bhagalpur district. The deceased's family claimed that he used to get upset each time he lost a game of PUBG, however, the police believe the minor could've taken the extreme step after a girl he loved rejected his proposal.

394.title: Govt denies report saying wheat reserves are lowest in 14 yrs, says 'stocks sufficient'
394.article_body: After a Bloomberg report said that wheat reserves in India in August declined to the lowest level in 14 years, the government said the country's wheat stocks are "sufficient" for "our domestic requirements". "There is no such plan to import wheat into India," said the Department of Food and Public Distribution replying to the report.

395.title: Karthikeya 2's Hindi version earns ₹11 cr, RGV calls it 'bigger' than RRR & KGF
395.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to laud filmmaker Chandoo Mondeti whose film 'Karthikeya 2' has collected ₹11.25 crore so far in the Hindi belt. He wrote, "#karthikeya2 on 2nd Friday doing double collections of Aamir Khan's Laal Singh Chaddha and Akshay Kumar's Raksha Bandhan." RGV added, "K2 is bigger blockbuster than RRR and KGF2...CONGRATS to Chandoo Mondeti."

396.title: NGO owner forces 25-yr-old woman into flesh trade in B'luru, gets her gangraped; arrested
396.article_body: The Karnataka Police have arrested the owner of an NGO called 'Nav Bharat' and her two associates on charges of forcing a 25-year-old woman into flesh trade and getting her gangraped, police said on Sunday. The police have booked cases under IPC Section 370 (buying any person as a slave) and the Immoral Traffic Prevention Act, 1956.

397.title: Odegaard's brace helped Arsenal beat Bournemouth in Premier League
397.article_body: Captain Martin Odegaard scored twice inside the opening 11 minutes before William Saliba's goal in the second half helped Arsenal defeat newly-promoted Bournemouth 3-0 in the Premier League on Saturday. With this, Arsenal moved to the top of the points table. Notably, it is the first time Arsenal have won their opening three matches since the 2004-05 season.

398.title: Priyadarshan to direct his first Malayalam thriller
398.article_body: Filmmaker Priyadarshan will be directing and producing his first Malayalam thriller with Shane Nigam and Arjun Ashokan as the lead. He said the shoot will begin in November "in a start-to-finish schedule of 45 days in Cochin". Priyadarshan, who has also written the film, said the basic idea of the film is inspired by Japanese filmmaker Akira Kurosawa's 'Stray Dog'.

399.title: E-hawala gang with alleged links to Pak busted in Gurugram, 4 held
399.article_body: Police on Saturday arrested four members of an e-hawala gang from Gurugram for allegedly threatening a businessman and demanding ₹5 lakh from him. The victim reportedly received threats through a video call on his WhatsApp number, police said. As many as 99 ATM cards were recovered from the gang's possession, which has alleged links with other gang members in Pakistan.

400.title: Kangana suing Filmfare for inviting her, says 'Shocked they are still nominating me'
400.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has revealed she's going to sue Filmfare for inviting her as they want to give her an award. "I've banned unethical..and totally unfair practices like Filmfare since 2014," she wrote. "I'm shocked to know...they're still nominating me. It's beneath my dignity...work ethics and value system to encourage such corrupt practices...that's why I've decided to sue Filmfare," she added.
